qas.question: Who did John Kerry choose to be by his side as the potential Vice President?
How many candidates did John Kerry name as potential prospects to be his running mate?
What was the Kerry/Edwards slogan that was released prior to the start of the convention in Boston?

answers.text: "stronger at home and more respected in the world."

qas.question: Which part of Kerry's Boston speech made reference to his military experience?

answers.text: "I'm John Kerry and I'm reporting for duty."

qas.question: Which famous line from Kerry's speech was later featured in one of his later television ad campaigns?

answers.text: "the future doesn't belong to fear, it belongs to freedom"

qas.question: On what date did Tom Vilsack choose John Edwards as his running mate?
In what city did Tom Vilsack speak at the DNC?

plausible_answers.text: Sen John Edwards, Rep Dick Gephardt

qas.question: What other two candidates did Tom Vilsack have on his list for possible running mates?

plausible_answers.text: a promise to make America "stronger at home and more respected in the world.

qas.question: What was the slogan for Vilsack/Edwards at the DNC?
What did Vilsack mention that the future belonged to in his famous quote?

context: On <b5_0>July 6<b5_0/>, John Kerry selected <a0_0>John Edwards<a0_0/> as his running mate, shortly before the 2004 Democratic National Convention in <b6_0>Boston<b6_0/>, held later that month. Days before Kerry announced Edwards as his running mate, Kerry gave a short list of <a1_0>three<a1_0/> candidates: <b7_0>Sen John Edwards, Rep Dick Gephardt<b7_0/>, and Gov Tom Vilsack. Heading into the convention, the Kerry/Edwards ticket unveiled their new slogan—<b8_0>a promise to make America <a2_0>"stronger at home and more respected in the world.<b8_0/>"<a2_0/> Kerry made his Vietnam War experience the prominent theme of the convention. In accepting the nomination, he began his speech with, <a3_0>"I'm John Kerry and I'm reporting for duty."<a3_0/> He later delivered what may have been the speech's most memorable line when he said, <a4_0>"the future doesn't belong to fear, it belongs to <b9_0>freedom<b9_0/>"<a4_0/>, a quote that later appeared in a Kerry/Edwards television advertisement.
